com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.model

Class SharedViewModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
      • com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.model.SharedViewModel

  • public class SharedViewModel
extends androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel
    The model shared between each fragment, keeping track of the data each page of the application needs.

    • Method Detail

      • getSubscription

        public Subscription getSubscription(int index)
        Get a subscription object from the list. This will fetch from the list of subscriptions currently viewable (if the list is filtered by search or sort).
        Parameters:
        index - index of the subscription to get
        Returns:
        a subscription object

      • getFullSubscriptionList

        public java.util.List<Subscription> getFullSubscriptionList()
        Get the entire subscription list regardless of sorting or filtering.
        Returns:
        a list of every subscription in ID order

      • addSubscription

        public void addSubscription(Subscription subscription)
        Add a subscription to the end of the list.
        Parameters:
        subscription - a subscription object to add to the list

      • updateSubscription

        public void updateSubscription(Subscription subscription,
                               int index)
        Update a subscription at a given index by replacing it with a new instance.
        Parameters:
        subscription - the new subscription to put in the list
        index - the index of the subscription to replace

      • deleteSubscription

        public void deleteSubscription(int index)
        Remove a subscription from the list at a given index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the subscription to remove

      • numSubscriptionsVisible

        public int numSubscriptionsVisible()
        Get the number of subscriptions currently viewable on the page.
        Returns:
        the number of subscriptions as an int

      • numSubscriptionsTotal

        public int numSubscriptionsTotal()
        Get the total number of subscriptions, regardless of what is visible.
        Returns:
        the total number of subscriptions as an int

      • filterList

        public void filterList(java.lang.CharSequence searchText)
        Filter the viewable list of subscriptions based on some string input. The given string will filter the list to include only subscriptions that contain that string in their name.
        Parameters:
        searchText - What text should be included in each subscription's name

      • sortList

        public void sortList(java.util.Comparator<Subscription> comparator,
                     java.lang.CharSequence searchText)
        Sort the underlying re-orderable list. This also requires the search text to be passed in so we can update the viewable list with any search conditions as well.
        Parameters:
        comparator - A comparator function that takes two subscriptions and returns -1 if sub1 < sub2, 1 if sub1 > sub2, or 0 if they are equal
        searchText - The next in the search box

      • getSubsDueOnDate

        public java.util.List<Subscription> getSubsDueOnDate(java.util.Date date)
        Get the subscriptions that have a next payment date due on the given date, and return a list containing these subscriptions. It will check any number of payment dates in the future, not just the immediate next payment date.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to check for subscriptions on
        Returns:
        a list of subscription objects due on the given date

      • updateSubscriptionDates

        public int updateSubscriptionDates()
        Iterate through every subscription in the model and regenerate the relevant date info for those whose next payment dates have passed. A new ZeroTimeCalendar instance is created and used for this method.
        Returns:
        the number of subscriptions updated

      • updateSubscriptionDates

        int updateSubscriptionDates(ZeroTimeCalendar zeroTimeCalendar)
        Iterate through every subscription in the model and regenerate the relevant date info for those whose next payment dates have passed.
        Parameters:
        zeroTimeCalendar - a calendar of today's date with the time set to 0:00:00
        Returns:
        the number of subscriptions updated

      • loadFromFile

        public void loadFromFile(android.content.Context context)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads in the internal storage file to populate our list of subscriptions.
        Parameters:
        context - the current context of the application
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if something goes wrong in reading the file

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile(android.content.Context context)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Save every subscription currently in the list to a file in internal storage.
        Parameters:
        context - the current context of the application
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if something goes wrong writing to the file, or if not enough memory is available to write the file

      • deleteData

        public void deleteData(android.content.Context context)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Reset this application's data by clearing the current list and overwriting the saved file.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if something goes wrong accessing the save file

      • updateAllSubIds

        private void updateAllSubIds()
        Re-distribute IDs for every subscription, sequentially from 0 in the order of the full subscription list. This should be done if a subscription is removed, leaving a gap in the subscription IDs.

      • getAvailableMemory

        private long getAvailableMemory()
        Gets the available amount of memory in the system in bytes.
        Returns:
        the amount of memory the system has available

      • estimateNeededStorage

        private long estimateNeededStorage()
        Estimates how much storage in bytes the system will need to be able to save the subscriptions file. This estimate uses 500 times the number of subscriptions, so if there are 8 subscriptions saved, it'll estimate 4000 bytes, or about 4 megabytes. In practice, the actual space needed will be around half of that, but this is made to be a large enough estimation to account for lots of extra data, like long notes on each subscription. If there's no subscriptions, it defaults to 10 bytes.
        Returns:
        the estimate of how much space is needed in bytes
